# RightOmicsTools

This package is a set of tools to facilitate the analysis of single-cell
RNA-seq data in R. It is currently in development and will be updated
regularly with new functions and improvements.

## Quick start

You can get started with `RightOmicsTools` by following the [tutorial
vignette](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/articles/RightOmicsTools.html)
which will guide you through package installation as well as showing
some examples of the functions available.

## Vignettes

This package also contains three other vignettes, currently under
construction, one deep diving into [advanced customization of
visualization
functions](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/articles/Visualization.html),
another one demonstrating how to [create and visualize gene signatures
from GSEA
pathways](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/articles/GSEA.html),
and finally a last one showing helper functions designed to [facilitate
differential gene expression in pseudotime analysis with the tradeSeq
package](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/articles/tradeSeq.html),
with a focus on a heatmap visualization function of gene expression
along pseudotime, an often requested feature.

## Reference

All functions are [documented on
GitHub](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/index.html)
and help may also be accessed using `?` in R.

## Citation

Finally, if you would like to cite this package, you will find all
information
[here](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/authors.html).

# Package index

## Seurat

### Visualization

- [`Barplot_Cell_Proportion()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Barplot_Cell_Proportion.md)
  : Bar plot of the cell proportions in each identity
- [`DotPlot_Heatmap()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/DotPlot_Heatmap.md)
  : Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity
- [`Cell_Heatmap()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Cell_Heatmap.md)
  : Heatmap of gene expression in each cell
- [`Grid_VlnPlot()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Grid_VlnPlot.md)
  : Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity

### Helper Functions

- [`Right_DietSeurat()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Right_DietSeurat.md)
  : Reduce the size of a Seurat object
- [`GSEA_Signatures()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/GSEA_Signatures.md)
  : Gene signatures from GSEA-MSigDB pathways
- [`Find_Annotation_Markers()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Find_Annotation_Markers.md)
  : Get the top markers for fast annotation

## tradeSeq

### Visualization

- [`curveSmoothers()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/curveSmoothers.md)
  : Scatterplot of log-transformed counts, and average fitted GAM
  smoother curves along pseudotime
- [`heatmapSmoothers()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/heatmapSmoothers.md)
  : Heatmap of average fitted GAM smoothers along pseudotime

### Helper Functions

- [`tradeSeqPreprocess()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/tradeSeqPreprocess.md)
  :

  Remove genes with very low expression for tradeSeq analysis

- [`tradeSeqTests()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/tradeSeqTests.md)
  :

  Perform tradeSeq tests in parallel

## CIBERSORTx

- [`Reference_Matrix_Builder()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Reference_Matrix_Builder.md)
  : Builder of CIBERSORTx Reference Matrix
- [`Mixture_File_Builder()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Mixture_File_Builder.md)
  : Builder of CIBERSORTx Mixture File

## Data

- [`Right_Data()`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/Right_Data.md)
  : Data loader for vignettes
- [`ncRNA_human`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/ncRNA_human.md)
  : Human non-coding genes
- [`pseudogenes_mouse`](https://alexis-varin.github.io/RightOmicsTools/reference/pseudogenes_mouse.md)
  : Mouse pseudogenes
